oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mt. Sinai Baptist Church: Detail of colored glass window
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color photograph of eight over eight sash window. A half-circle window, divided into three triangular sections appears at the top. The church steeple is visible on the roof. The glass in the window is colored in a wash streaks of color.

Mt. Sinai Baptist Church is an African American church that was founded by a community of freed slaves on Foley's Hill in Clinton, TN during reconstruction. The historic church cemetery resides behind the newer church building, circa 1955. Of the grave markers, the earliest cemetery stone dates to approximately 1902. When the property was surveyed in 1998, William A. Caldwell, Jr. served as the pastor.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee;
sash windows; steeples;
